dynamo.nodeutilities

Class Ring

  • java.lang.Object
    • dynamo.nodeutilities.Ring

  • public class Ring
extends java.lang.Object
    The representation of the current network, as a ring; it contains the Nodes and the logic operations that can be performed on the ring

      • addPeer

        public boolean addPeer(Peer peer)
        Adds a Peer to the Collection
        Parameters:
        peer - the Peer to be added to the Collection
        Returns:
        true if the Peer was not already in the Collection, false otherwise

      • addPeer

        public boolean addPeer(Peer peer,
                       boolean force)
        Add a Peer to the Collection
        Parameters:
        peer - the Peer to be added to the Collection
        force - true if we want to replace a possibily already existing Peer (with the same key) with the new one
        Returns:
        true if the operation went good

      • addPeers

        public boolean addPeers(java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.Integer,Peer> peers)
        Adds a set of Peers to the Collection
        Parameters:
        peers - the set of Peers to be added to the Collection
        Returns:
        true if the entire set was not already in the Collection, false otherwise

      • removePeer

        public boolean removePeer(java.lang.Integer key)
        Removes a Peer from the Collection
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the Peer that has to be removed
        Returns:
        true if the Peer is contained in the Collection and correctly removed, false otherwise

      • nextEqual

        private java.lang.Integer nextEqual(java.lang.Integer key)
        Gets the least equal or greater key
        Parameters:
        key - the predecessor of the desired key
        Returns:
        the least equal or greater key, or null if there is no such key

      • next

        private java.lang.Integer next(java.lang.Integer key)
        Gets the least greater key
        Parameters:
        key - the predecessor of the desired key
        Returns:
        the least greater key, or null if there is no such key

        Gets the Peer corresponding to the given key
        Parameters:

      • getNextPeer

        public Peer getNextPeer(java.lang.Integer key)
        Gets the Peer next to the given key
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the predecessor of the desired Peer
        Returns:
        the Peer having the next key in the Ring

      • getNumberOfPeers

        public java.lang.Integer getNumberOfPeers()
        Gets the number of Peers currently joined to the Ring
        Returns:
        the number of Peers currently joined to the Ring

      • keyExists

        public boolean keyExists(java.lang.Integer key)
        Returns true if a Peer with a certain key belongs to the Ring, false otherwise
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the Peer that has to be checked
        Returns:
        true if a Peer with a certain key belongs to the Ring, false otherwise

      • getReplicasFromKey

        public java.util.ArrayList<Peer> getReplicasFromKey(java.lang.Integer N,
                                                    java.lang.Integer itemKey)
        Returns an array of Peers, where the peers are the Nodes responsible for the replica of a specific data item. The method takes the first N peers in the ring with key greater or equal to itemKey. In case the number of peers in the system is less or equal than N, then all peers are returned.
        Parameters:
        N - The number of replicas responsible for a data item
        itemKey - the item's key to retrieve
        Returns:
        an array of Peers

      • selfIsNextNClockwise

        public boolean selfIsNextNClockwise(java.lang.Integer startingKey,
                                    java.lang.Integer N,
                                    java.lang.Integer selfKey)
        Checks if this Node is among the next N nodes in clockwise order starting from a certain key value
        Parameters:
        startingKey - the starting key
        N - the number of replicas to check for
        selfKey - the key of this node
        Returns:
        true if the node is among the next N clockwise nodes from startingKey, false otherwise

      • isNodeWithinRangeFromItem

        public boolean isNodeWithinRangeFromItem(java.lang.Integer itemKey,
                                         java.lang.Integer nodeKey,
                                         java.lang.Integer N)
        Checks if a certain node is withing a certain range from an item in the ring
        Parameters:
        itemKey - the item to be checked
        nodeKey - the node we are testing for
        N - the allowed range (number of nodes) from the item to the node (with the node included)
        Returns:
        true if the given node is withing N number of nodes from the item (i.e. it should contain a replica of the given item)

      • getPeers

        public java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.Integer,Peer> getPeers()
        Gets the entire set of Peers currently joined to the Ring
        Returns:
        the entire set of Peers currently joined to the Ring
